alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake County through 530 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cary, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, RDU International, Morrisville, Rolesville, Lake Wheeler, William B Umstead State Park and Research Triangle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
